title: Quiz  - SchemesTap 1st to 15th December 2022
instruction: India is the world's third-largest market in aviation sector. The objective of UDAN scheme is to connect small and medium cities with big cities through air service. UDAN is a market driven scheme. An airport which is included in the awarded routes of UDAN and requires upgradation/development for commencement of RCS operations, is developed under "Revival of unserved and underserved airports" scheme.

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. It is a Centrally sponsored scheme.

B. It provides assistance to all states and UTs where 75 communities identified as PVTGs reside.

C. This scheme operates as a gap filling intervention targeted specifically for upliftment of such communities.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. State Governments have been given the flexibility of utilizing the funds using the gaps identified through Base Line Surveys.

B. Funds in the scheme are released under 2 major components of Grant-in-Aid and Creation of Capital Assets.

C. Impact assessment of the scheme has been undertaken by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs and NITI Aayog.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. Minimum number of members in FPO will be 200 in plain area and 300 in North East & hilly areas.

B. It was launched in the year 2019.

C. At least 25% of the targeted FPOs would be in aspirational districts with at least one FPO in each block of aspirational districts.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the total budgetary outlay of scheme mentioned in above paragraph?
options: Rs. 2369 Crore
Rs. 3568 Crore
Rs. 4496 Crore
Rs. 6865 Crore
Rs. 8978 Crore

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the subsidy provided under the above scheme?

A. Financial assistance - up to Rs 15 lakh per FPO.

B. Matching equity grant - up to Rs 5,000 per farmer member of FPO.

C. Credit guarantee facility - up to Rs 1 crore of project loan per FPO.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. In the Phase-II Programme Central Financial Assistance (CFA) for the residential sector has been restructured with availability of 50% CFA for RTS systems up to 3 kW capacity.

B. It was launched in the year 2020.

C. For Group Housing Societies/Residential Welfare Associations (GHS/RAW), CFA will be limited to 40% for RTS plants for supply of power to common facilities.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy has launched Grid Connected Rooftop solar scheme to achieve a cumulative capacity of ________ from Rooftop Solar Projects by the year 2022.
options: 35,000 MW
40,000 MW
45,000 MW
50,000 MW
60,000 MW

quiz.text: What is the total central financial support that will be provided under the scheme mentioned in above paragraph?
options: Rs. 8,814 crore
Rs. 9,814 crore
Rs. 10,814 crore
Rs. 11,814 crore
Rs. 12,814 crore

quiz.text: Which scheme has been described in the above passage?
options: Atal Bhujal Yojana
Jal Jeevan Mission
National Rural Drinking Water Programme
AMRUT 2.0
Swachh Bharat Mission (Gramin)

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements are correct with respect to the above-mentioned scheme?

A. Total estimated cost of this scheme is Rs 3.60 Lakh Crore.

B. Tap water supply is to be provided to all rural SC/ST households.

C.  Minimum water supply to be available is 55 litres per person per day.
options: A and B
B and C
A and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a component under the scheme described above?
options: Retrofitting of completed and ongoing schemes to provide FHTCs at minimum service level of 45 lpcd.
Greywater management
Technological interventions for removal of contaminants where water quality is an issue.
Wherever necessary, bulk water transfer, treatment plants and distribution network to cater to every rural household.
Support activities, i.e. water quality laboratories, water quality testing & surveillance, R&D, knowledge centre, capacity building of communities, etc.

quiz.text: Recently (February 2022), the _______ district from Himachal Pradesh has become 100th district to have provided tap water connection to all rural households.
options: Bilaspur
Dharmshala
Solan
Chamba
Hamirpur

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. Under this scheme, the crops of Indian farmers will be transported from one place to another through special airplanes.

B. Through this initiative, farmers will get good income from their produce.

C. Airport charges such as parking charges and terminal navigational landing charges on select Indian airports for air cargo operators has been waived off under the scheme if the agricultural cargo is over 50% of the total chargeable weight carried.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: In which year was the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph launched?
options: 2015
2017
2019
2020
2021

quiz.text: Which of the following is the nodal ministry for the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry of Civil Aviation
Ministry of Roads, Transport and Highways
Ministry of Food Processing and Industries
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. It is being implemented by Ministry of Minority Affairs.

B. It was launched in the year 2012-13.

C. It is a centrally sponsored scheme.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: The scheme mentioned in the above paragraph offers assistance to which among the following Minorities communities in the country?
options: Muslim
Sikh
Christians
Buddhist
All of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is not one of the feature of the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: The programme is run with the help of NGOs, Civil societies and Government Institutions all over the country
It is a training programme conducted for women belonging to minority community between the age group of 18 years to 65 years.
The scheme provides for 6 days training programme followed by handholding for a period of one year.
The training is provided on various pre-designed Training modules covering issues relating to women
All of the above are key features

quiz.text:
With respect to the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph, identify the incorrect statement:

A.     SFAC is the technology provider.

B.     It is accessible in 11 languages.

C.     It markets only 193 agricultural and horticultural commodities.
options: Only A
Only B
Only C
Both A and B
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with regards to the scheme mentioned in the paragraph?
options: The scheme was launched in 2017
The interested states are required to carry out four reforms in their APMC Act.
There is a provision of e-trading as a mode of price discovery.
Integration with AGMARKNET will help farmers to easily locate and reach the selected mandis and sell their agri-produce.
All are correct

quiz.text: Central sector schemes are 100% funded by the Union government and implemented by the Central Government machinery. Which of the following organisations/ institutes is responsible for funding the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: SFAC
NFCL
AITF
Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
Both 1 and 4

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement is correct regarding the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?

A. e-NWRs module links large logistic aggregator platforms, which will provide choices to users.

B. eNAM Platform of Platforms was launched to integrate various service providers platform/ on boarding of service providers to enhance farmers accessibility digitally .

C. Free software & assistance of Rs 75 Lakh per mandi for related hardware including quality assaying equipments & creation of infrastructure
options: Only A
Both A and B
Both B and C
Only C
Only B

quiz.text:
Which of the following is the skill provided in the New India Literacy Mission?

A. Critical life skills

B. Vocational skills

C. Basic education

D. Continuing education
options: A, B and C
B, C and D
A, C and D
A, B and D
A, B. C and D

quiz.text: What is the estimated Central Government Share of the total outlay for the NILP?
options: Rs 337 Crore
Rs 700 Crore
Rs 800 crore
Rs 1037 crore
Rs 1337 crore

quiz.text: The NILP aims to achieve basic financial and numerical literacy using OTLAS. What does A stands for in OTLAS?
options: Achievement
Accreditation
Acceleration
Assessment
Ambitious

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. It is being implemented by Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare.

B. It was launched in the year 2019.

C. The scheme has been continued till 2025-26.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: The products identified under the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph will be supported by which scheme?
options: PMSVANidhi
PM-FME
PM Kisan SAMPADA
PM KISAN
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is not one of the objective of the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: To convert each District of the country into an Export Hub
To support local exporters/manufacturers to scale up manufacturing
To generate employment in the District
To find potential buyers outside India
All of the above are objectives of the scheme

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. It is being implemented by Department of Food and Public Distribution.

B. It was launched in the year 2020.

C. This card will ensure all beneficiaries especially migrants can access Public Distribution System (PDS) across the nation from any PDS shop of their own choice.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the price at which migrants would be able to buy rice from PDS stores per kg?
options: Rs. 1
Rs. 2
Rs. 3
Rs. 5
Rs. 8

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the features of the scheme mentioned above?

A. A standard format for ration card has been prepared.

B. State governments have been asked to issue the ration card in bi-lingual format.

C. The states have also been told to have a 20-digit standard ration card number.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana Urban?
options: PMAY-U was launched in the year 2015.
Central Grant is of Rs. 1 Lakh per house for in-situ rehabilitation of slum dwellers.
Families having only one pucca house can avail benefit under this scheme.
It is implemented as Centrally Sponsored Scheme except for the Credit Linked Subsidy component which is a Central Sector Scheme.
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are the components under PMAY-U?
options: In-Situ Rehabilitation of Slum Dwellers (ISSR)
Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme (CLSS)
Affordable Housing in Partnership (AHP)
Beneficiary-led Individual House Construction/ Enhancement (BLC-N/BLC-E)
All of the above

quiz.text: Under the Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme component, an interest subsidy of _____ is provided to LIG (Lower Income Group) on loan amount up to Rs. _______.
options: 4%, 12 lakh
3%, 18 lakh
5%, 15 lakh
6.5%, 6 lakh
5.4%, 8 lakh

quiz.text: What is the amount of central assistance provided per EWS house under Affordable Housing in Partnership (AHP) component?
options: Rs. 55 thousand
Rs. 75 thousand
Rs. 1.5 Lakh
Rs. 2.5 Lakh
Rs. 1.0 Lakh

quiz.text: Under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana, what is the cap on Centres premium subsidy for irrigated area/crops?
options: 20%
25%
30%
40%
50%

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana and choose the correct ones.

A. It has replaced the National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS).

B. States have been allowed to set up their own insurance companies for implementing the scheme

C. Uniform premium of 3% for Kharif Crops, 2.5% for Rabi Crops and 5% for commercial and Horticulture crops.
options: A and B only
B and C only
A and C only
A, B and C
None of the Above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to the above scheme?
options: 0.5% of total premium collected by insurance companies to be spent on Information, Communication and Education (ICE) activities
Comprehensive insurance coverage against crop loss Pre-harvest + Post-harvest (up to 14 days) + in case farmer didnt sow seed because of contingency ( 25% of sum insured)
Allocation of business to Insurance Companies to be done for 2 years
Use of Remote Sensing Technology, Smart phones & Drones for quick estimation of crop losses to ensure early settlement of claims
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are the key features of the above discussed scheme?

a. It is a Central Sector Scheme.

b. The entire responsibility of identification of beneficiary farmer families rests with the State / UT Governments.

c. An amount of Rs 8000 per year in four equal instalments of Rs 2,000 each (every three months) is released by the Central Government online.
options: a and b only
b and c only
a and c only
a, b and c
None of the Above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to eligibility criterion under above Scheme?

A. Only Small & Marginal Farmers families, with combined landholding up to 2 hectares are eligible

B. Institutional land holders are not eligible under this scheme

C. Superannuated employees availing monthly pension of Rs. 10,000 or more are not eligible
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to above scheme?
options: Farmers in villages situated in urban areas are not eligible under scheme
Micro land holdings, which are not cultivable, are excluded from PM KISAN
Agricultural land being used for non-agricultural purposes is not covered
Aadhar based eKYC is mandatory for PM KISAN registered farmers.
Family comprises of husband, wife and minor children who own cultivable land as per land records of the concerned State/UT

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement is/are correct with respect to above scheme?

A. Tenant farmers are considered eligible beneficiaries under the scheme

B. The scheme is being administered by Ministry of Finance

C. Cut-off date for determination of eligibility is 01 Feb 2019, and no changes thereafter shall be considered for eligibility for next 4 years
options: A and C
B and C
A and B
None of the above
A, B and C

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. It is being implemented by Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying.

B. It was launched in the year 2021.

C. Some of the beneficiaries include Fishers, Fish farmers, Fish workers, Fish vendors, SCs/STs/Women/Differently abled persons.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the total outlay of scheme mentioned in above paragraph?
options: Rs. 14550 Crore
Rs. 17635 Crore
Rs. 18975 Crore
Rs. 20050 Crore
Rs. 21790 Crore

quiz.text:
Which among the following statements are correct with respect to the targets for the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?

A. Increasing fish production to 22 million metric tons by 2025-26.

B. Increasing contribution of fisheries sector to the Agriculture GVA to about 9% by 2025-26.

C. Doubling export earnings to Rs.1,00,000 crores by 2025-26.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
None of the above
A, B and C

quiz.text: What does R stands for in PM SHRI Schools Scheme launched recently?
options: Rising
Raising
Resource
Recover
Resilient

quiz.text:
Which among the following statements is/are correct about the Scheme - PM SHRI Schools?

A. It is a centrally sponsored Scheme.

B. It will be implemented with a total project cost of Rs. 27360 crore for the period of five years from year 2022-23 to 2026-27.

C. Under the scheme, more than 14500 schools across the country will be developed as PM SHRI Schools.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: As per scheme, which of the following schools managed by Centre/State/UT Governments / local self-governments having UDISE+ code would be considered for selection under the Scheme?
options: Elementary schools (Class 1-12)
Elementary schools (Class 1-5/1-8)
Secondary/ Sr. Secondary Schools (Class 1-8)
Secondary/ Sr. Secondary Schools (Class1-10/1-12/6-10/6-12)
Both 2 & 4

quiz.text: As per scheme, ______ of the PM SHRI Schools will be covered under ICT, smart classrooms and digital initiatives?
options: 100%
90%
80%
75%
50%

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to PM-SVANidhi Scheme?

A. It is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme

B. NABARD acts as the implementing agency for this scheme

C. Aadhar card is mandatory to enrol in SVANidhi
options: A and B
B and C
A only
B only
C only

quiz.text: On timely or early repayment of the loan, an interest subsidy of ____ per annum is credited to the bank accounts of beneficiaries through Direct Benefit Transfer.
options: 5.75%
6.25%
7.0%
7.5%
7.75%

quiz.text: With respect to the above scheme, which of the following statements is incorrect?
options: All street vendors who have fully repaid their first loan are eligible for second loan of up to 20,000/-.
With the extension of scheme till December 2024, loan amount has increased to 8,100 crore.
Monthly cashback in the range of Rs. 50 to 100 is provided on digital transactions.
Non-Banking Financial Companies are not included under Lending Institutions.
Vendors engaged in vending in urban areas and surrounding semi-urban areas and rural areas are eligible under the scheme.

quiz.text: What is the target of exports in the RoDTEP scheme?
options: Rs 30000 crore
Rs 40000 crore
Rs 50000 crore
Rs 60000 crore
Rs 70000 crore

quiz.text: RoDTEP rates will be notified by which of the following committee?
options: G K Pillai
G K Vasan
Amid Hussain
Srinivasan
Venkataraman

quiz.text: Which of the following is not the component of RoDTEP scheme?
options: Reimburse input taxes and duties
WTO compliant
Manual Refund route
Avoid Double taxation
Attempt to reverse export fall

quiz.text:
Which of the following are the targets of the above scheme?

A. Reduction of AT&C losses to pan-India levels of 15-18% by 2024-25.

B. Reduction of ACS-ARR gap to zero by 2024-25.

C. Developing Institutional Capabilities for Modern DISCOMs.
options: A only
B and C only
B only
C only
A and C only

quiz.text:
Which of the following are the salient features of the above scheme?

A. Agricultural connections would be covered only through Feeder Meters.

B. Artificial Intelligence would be leveraged to analyze data generated through IT/OT devices including System Meters, prepaid Smart meters.

C. This Scheme converges with the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha Evem Utthan Mahabhiyan Scheme.
options: A and B only
B and C only
A, B and C
A and C only
B only

quiz.text: What is the grant for one prepaid smart meter provided under the scheme for special category states?
options: Rs 900
Rs 1350
Rs 1800
Rs 2250
Rs 2700

quiz.text:
Which of the following are not correct with reference to the above scheme?

A. Allocation for uniforms under RTE Act enhanced from Rs. 400 to Rs. 600 per child per annum.

B. Allocation for textbooks under the RTE Act, enhanced from Rs. 150/250 to Rs. 250/400 per child per annum.

C. Allocation for Children with Special Needs (CwSN) increased from Rs. 3000 to Rs. 5000 per child per annum.

D. Stipend of Rs. 500 per month for Girls with Special Needs from Classes 1 to 12.
options: A and B only
B and C only
C and D only
A and D only
B and D only

quiz.text: Upgradation of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas were done to which of the following classes under the scheme?
options: 8-12
6-9
6-10
6-12
9-12

quiz.text: What is the probable amount of library grant for a school that can be obtained from the above scheme?
options: Rs 17000
Rs 26000
Rs 34000
Rs 42000
Rs 58000

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the scheme X?

A. Ministry of Commerce & Industry is the nodal ministry for the scheme.

B. It was launched in the year 2017.

C. It promotes awareness and adoption of Intellectual Property Rights amongst startups.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: The scheme X has been extended by the Government of India till __________.
options: 31st March 2023
30th April 2023
31st March 2024
30th April 2024
31st March 2025

quiz.text: The scheme X facilitates the startups in order to file applications for __________, through registered facilitators (like TIFAC, NRDC, etc.) in appropriate IP offices by paying only the statutory fees.
options: Patents
Designs
Trademarks
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. It is being implemented by Ministry of Civil Aviation.

B. It was launched in the year 2015.

C. Airports Authority of India is the implementing agency for the scheme.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?

A. The scheme gives special focus to hilly states only.

B. The scheme would be in operation for a period of 15 years.

C. Landing charges, parking charges and Terminal Navigation Landing Charges will be imposed for RCS flights etc.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the fare at which the airlines have to sell tickets a specific number of seats for 1 hour of flying as per the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: Rs 2,000
Rs 2,500
Rs 3,000
Rs 3,500
Rs 4,000
